questions.questionText: Solve for \( x \): \( 3x - 5 = 10 \)
questions.explanation: Adding 5 to both sides gives \( 3x = 15 \), and dividing by 3 gives \( x = 5 \).

questions.questionText: If \( y = 2x + 3 \), what is \( y \) when \( x = 4 \)?
questions.explanation: Substituting \( x = 4 \) into \( y = 2x + 3 \), we get \( y = 11 \).

questions.questionText: What is the solution to \( x^2 = 16 \)?
questions.explanation: The square root of 16 is \( \pm 4 \).

questions.questionText: Simplify \( 2(x + 3) = 14 \). What is \( x \)?
questions.explanation: Expanding gives \( 2x + 6 = 14 \). Subtracting 6 and dividing by 2 gives \( x = 4 \).
Substituting \( y = 2 \), the equation becomes \( 2x + 6 = 12 \). Solving gives \( x = 3 \).

title: Geometry Essentials
description: A quiz to test your basic geometry knowledge.

questions.questionText: What is the sum of interior angles in a triangle?
questions.explanation: The sum of angles in any triangle is always \( 180^\circ \).

questions.questionText: What is the area of a triangle with base \( b = 5 \) and height \( h = 10 \)?
questions.explanation: The area is \( \frac{1}{2}bh \). Substituting values gives \( \frac{1}{2}(5)(10) = 25 \).

questions.questionText: What is the formula for the circumference of a circle?
questions.explanation: The circumference of a circle is \( 2\pi r \).

questions.questionText: Find the length of the hypotenuse in a right triangle with legs \( 3 \) and \( 4 \).
questions.explanation: Using the Pythagorean theorem: \( c = \sqrt{3^2 + 4^2} = 5 \).

questions.questionText: What is the volume of a cube with side length \( a = 3 \)?
questions.explanation: The volume of a cube is \( a^3 \). Substituting \( a = 3 \), \( 3^3 = 27 \).

title: Calculus Basics
description: Assess your understanding of basic calculus concepts.

questions.questionText: What is the derivative of \( x^3 \)?
questions.explanation: The power rule states \( \frac{d}{dx}(x^n) = nx^{n-1} \).

questions.questionText: What is \( \int 2x dx \)?
questions.explanation: The integral of \( 2x \) is \( x^2 + C \).

questions.questionText: Find the limit of \( \lim_{x \to 0} \frac{\sin x}{x} \).
questions.explanation: The limit \( \frac{\sin x}{x} \) as \( x \to 0 \) is a standard result: \( 1 \).

questions.questionText: What is the slope of the tangent line to \( y = x^2 \) at \( x = 2 \)?
questions.explanation: The derivative \( \frac{dy}{dx} = 2x \). Substituting \( x = 2 \), slope is \( 4 \).

questions.questionText: Evaluate \( \frac{d}{dx}(e^x) \).
questions.explanation: The derivative of \( e^x \) is \( e^x \).

title: Statistics Basics
description: Test your understanding of basic statistical concepts.

questions.questionText: What is the mean of the data set \( [2, 4, 6, 8, 10] \)?
questions.explanation: The mean is calculated as \( \frac{2 + 4 + 6 + 8 + 10}{5} = 6 \).

questions.questionText: What is the median of the data set \( [3, 1, 4, 2, 5] \)?
questions.explanation: Arranging the data in order \( [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] \), the middle value is \( 3 \).

questions.questionText: What is the mode of the data set \( [7, 9, 7, 8, 10, 7] \)?
questions.explanation: The mode is the most frequent value, which is \( 7 \).

questions.questionText: What is the range of the data set \( [12, 15, 10, 20, 18] \)?
questions.explanation: The range is \( 20 - 10 = 10 \).

questions.questionText: What is the variance of the data set \( [2, 4, 6] \)?
questions.explanation: Variance is calculated as \( \frac{\sum (x_i - \bar{x})^2}{n} \).

title: Probability Basics
description: Assess your knowledge of basic probability concepts.

questions.questionText: A die is rolled once. What is the probability of rolling a \( 4 \)?
questions.explanation: A die has 6 sides, so the probability of rolling any one number is \( \frac{1}{6} \).

questions.questionText: A coin is flipped twice. What is the probability of getting two heads?
questions.explanation: The probability of heads is \( \frac{1}{2} \) for each flip. \( \frac{1}{2} \times \frac{1}{2} = \frac{1}{4} \).

questions.questionText: What is the probability of selecting a red card from a standard deck of 52 cards?
questions.explanation: Half of the 52 cards are red (26 cards), so the probability is \( \frac{26}{52} = \frac{1}{2} \).

questions.questionText: If two dice are rolled, what is the probability of rolling a sum of \( 7 \)?
questions.explanation: There are 6 combinations that result in a sum of \( 7 \), and 36 total outcomes: \( \frac{6}{36} = \frac{1}{6} \).

questions.questionText: What is the probability of drawing a king or a queen from a standard deck of cards?
questions.explanation: There are 4 kings and 4 queens in a deck, totaling 8 cards: \( \frac{8}{52} = \frac{2}{13} \).
